<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 304, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics 1 (M1)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 585]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 724, 600]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 593, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 615, 606, 630]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 644, 608, 660]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 756, 675]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 675, 440, 690]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 556, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the minimum distance between the particles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A car of mass \(1200\mathrm{kg}\) is moving on a straight road against a constant force of \(850\mathrm{N}\) resisting the motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 120, 156, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 856, 139]]<|/det|>
On a part of the road that is horizontal, the car moves with a constant speed of \(42 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 146, 185, 164]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 144, 702, 165]]<|/det|>
Calculate, in kW, the power developed by the engine of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 146, 920, 164]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 415, 183, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 415, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
Given that this power is suddenly increased by \(6\mathrm{kW}\), find the instantaneous acceleration of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 431, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On a part of the road that is inclined at \(\theta^{\circ}\) to the horizontal, the car moves up the hill at a constant speed of \(24 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\) , with the engine working at \(80 \mathrm{~kW}\). Find \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 87, 744, 201]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 217, 920, 317]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a fixed block with a horizontal top surface and a surface which is inclined at an angle of \(\theta^{\circ}\) to the horizontal, where \(\sin \theta = \frac{3}{5}\). A particle \(A\) of mass \(0.3 \mathrm{kg}\) rests on the horizontal surface and is attached to one end of a light inextensible string. The string passes over a small smooth pulley \(P\) fixed at the edge of the block. The other end of the string is attached to a particle \(B\) of mass \(1.5 \mathrm{kg}\) which rests on the sloping surface of the block. The system is released from rest with the string taut.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 330, 156, 348]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 330, 908, 349]]<|/det|>
Given that the block is smooth, find the acceleration of particle \(A\) and the tension in the string.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 345, 920, 364]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that the block is rough. The coefficient of friction between \(A\) and the block is \(\mu\) and the coefficient of friction between \(B\) and the block is also \(\mu\). In the first 3 seconds of the motion, \(A\) does not reach \(P\) and \(B\) does not reach the bottom of the sloping surface. The speed of the particles after \(3 \mathrm{~s}\) is \(5 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\). Find the acceleration of particle \(A\) and the value of \(\mu\). [9]
